page.title: 07LAYING A PIPELINE
page.content:
This pipeline is currently being laid through East Wellow. The pipeline will be one hundred and thirty miles long and will carry petrol, oil and gas. It will be finished by the end of this year. At the moment they have about one thousand men working on the pipeline for six days a week, starting at eight a.m. and finishing at seven p.m.
The pipeline is split into three sections each of which has its own base office. Laying the pipeline involves the use of heavy machinery such as diggers,cranes and pipe lowerers. The pipeline is made of steel and is buried three feet deep.It will carry five hundred million gallons of fuel each year and will cost forty million pounds.
